definition: thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Will the traditional off-line clothing sales business combined with online transactions.
sentences.chinese: 将传统的线下服装销售业务相结合的在线交易。

sentences.english: This is the time you do your offline work – write memos, write code, etc.
sentences.chinese: 这个时间你可以做线下工作，比如写备忘录什么的。

sentences.english: Think about the colors you use in your offline promotional materials.
sentences.chinese: 想想你设计的一些的线下的促销宣传单的颜色。

sentences.english: This is unfair to taxpayers who conduct trade offline.
sentences.chinese: 这对进行线下贸易的纳税人是不公平的。

sentences.english: Until recently, it was believed that that only pertained to "offline" relationships.
sentences.chinese: 直到现在，这个理论仍然相信唯一与线下的关系有关。
多多利用线下活动，比如博客嘉年华等。

sentences.english: Mindshare will handle media duties connected with above- and below-the-line activity.
sentences.chinese: 传立媒体将处理线上和线下活动的媒介职责。

sentences.english: Online or off, retailers will always face the pressure to generate profit, Wainwright notes.
sentences.chinese: 无论是线上还是线下的零售商都面临着利润的压力。

sentences.english: Remember that networking happens both offline and online.
sentences.chinese: 记住交流同时发生在网上和线下。

sentences.english: There are offline shopping and networking events only for Shangpin members.
sentences.chinese: 此外尚品还会为会员举办线下的购物和交流活动。
赠送样品属于线下广告。

sentences.english: I have great friends, both online and off.
sentences.chinese: 我有很多朋友，不论线上还是线下。

definition: e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
GOME, electronics chain founded in Beijing in 1987
to retail/to sell individually or in small quantities
fresh produce and freshly prepared foods
